pros:
Work environment between staff was great and everyone supported each other
Clients were open with treatment goals and you feel like you're making a difference.
cons: Could possibly benefit from more concise communication from management and/or program managers at times but I don't have many negative things to say about TGC.

job_title: Community Justice Care Manager in Flagstaff, AZ
pros: Supportive management, good pay, good benefits, overtime
cons: Rough work/life balance, lack of training

pros: Good pay, the families and kids we work with are wonderful.. Coworkers are amazing.
cons: Leadership is clueless, punitive and completely out of touch with the employees. They have zero leadership training and regressive, controlling policies. They play favorites and try to pit employees against each other.

pros: One hour lunch, make your own schedule of when to take breaks/lunch
cons: A lot of areas to clean for low pay. 9 hours a day

review_title: Some great coworkers but chaotic on most days
pros:
- Easy to work with most of my coworkers as we were all around the same level of experience and figuring things out together. 
- Manager gave independence to do our work and didn't micromanage at all
- Learned a lot about the industry through working here and managers were very open to teaching anyone who asked. 
-if you like overtime, it was offered often and with a lot of hours too.
cons:
- Management was indecisive about things often which led to sharp pivot's on working being done.
- Turnover was high in certain areas which led to lots of OT being offered or shifts being moved around at the last minute and sometimes without adequate notice.
- Fairly consistent changes in senior leadership so there was no time to adjust to long term company strategies before a new leader would come in and we would re-adjust again. 
- Pay was quite low for some positions given the long hours and nature of the work.

pros:
Great coworkers
Flexible hours
Good leadership
cons:
Mentally Exhausting (It’s the field of course)
Not well organized

pros: Coworkers, Pay, Location, Ability to help community
cons: Management, Schedule not consistent, Lack of opportunity to move up

review_title: Experience depends on department to department
job_title: Dedicated Case Manager in Flagstaff, AZ
pros: Overall good quality of care to the consumers and clients. Even the difficult employees stay relatively focused on consumer care. The CEO is very personable and is seen often throughout the campus. Employees often complain that the place has to be run like a business, but the bottom line is that that is what it is - without the focus of making money, the doors couldn't stay open.
cons: High caseload. A lot of tedious paperwork. Inter-department communication is lacking to the point of frustrating. HR and upper management doesn't seem to fully know what happens on the lower levels. Often get threatened to be either written up or put on leave without pay.

pros: A private company bought them and increased salary.
cons: The pay bump comes at the cost of your time, dignity, family, and management does not care about you. CEO is a master puppeteer who cannot care less. CCO just does what he is told. Turnover is uncontrollable. There is no respect for staff. Any feedback is counted against you. In response to reasonable resignation dates, they hand you a box. Management does not practice ethics toward staff or clients.

pros:
-Very focused on consumer care
-Overall, good quality of staff
-Ability to work mostly around your own schedule, very flexible
cons:
-Upper management doesn't have much of an idea of what happens on the day-to-day
-Each department is compartmentalized, so there is difficulty in communicating between different departments

review_title: Glad there was a change in management
pros: Fantastic employees, great mission and purpose.  An agency that has helped tens of thousands of members of the community over time.
cons: Management was in fluctuation and turmoil for a few years which caused the agency as a whole to be a toxic environment for many.  Luckily, changes have been made that have created a positive shift.

pros: Working with clients and helping them understand that they have the power to make positive changes in their life.
cons: Realizing that some clients no matter how hard you try that some clients will continue using.

pros: The people at The Guidance Center are very friendly and welcoming.  It's one of the nicest places I've worked in this regard.
cons: Work in behavioral health is very demanding and somewhat relentless.  Anyone seeking a career in behavioral health should be taking good care of themselves.

pros: Good staff, hard working nurse managers as well as nurses.
cons: Non supportive upper management on medical side, poor leadership
